Title: Inventory Operations
Description: Manage inventory items, locations, and quantities.

Topics.Title: Viewing Inventory
Topics.Content:
Viewing Inventory

The Inventory tab provides a real-time view of all WIP items.

  • Search: Use the search bar to find items by Part Number, Job Number, or Location.
  • Filtering: Use the column headers to sort and filter the grid.
  • Right Panel: Toggle the Right Panel (Ctrl+Right Arrow) to see detailed information about the selected item.

Topics.Title: Advanced Entry
Topics.Summary: Use Advanced Inventory for complex transactions.
Topics.Content:
Advanced Inventory Entry

For high-volume or complex data entry, use the Advanced Inventory mode (Ctrl+Shift+A).

Modes

  • Single Entry: Detailed form for adding one item at a time with full validation.
  • Multi Entry: Rapidly add multiple items to the same location or job.
  • Import: Import inventory data from Excel spreadsheets.

Use the toggle buttons at the top of the Advanced Inventory screen to switch between these modes.

Topics.Title: Adding Inventory
Topics.Content:
Adding New Inventory

To add a new item:

  1. Navigate to the Inventory tab.
  2. Enter the Part Number (or scan a barcode).
  3. Enter the Operation.
  4. Enter the Quantity.
  5. Select or scan the Location.
  6. Click Save (Ctrl+S).

The system will validate the part number against the Infor Visual database before saving.

Topics.Title: Transferring Material
Topics.Content:
Transferring Material

To move material from one location to another:

  1. Navigate to the Transfer tab (Ctrl+3).
  2. Select the item you wish to move from the grid.
  3. Enter the Quantity to transfer.
  4. Select the Destination Location.
  5. Click Transfer (Ctrl+T).

The system will automatically deduct the quantity from the source location and add it to the destination location.

Topics.Title: Part Management
Topics.Content:
Part Management

Parts are the core of the inventory system.

Part Validation

All part numbers are validated against the Infor Visual ERP system. You cannot add inventory for a part that does not exist in Visual.

Part Details

Right-click on any part in the grid and select View Details to see extended information, including description, standard cost, and total quantity on hand across all locations.

Topics.Title: Operation Codes
Topics.Content:
Operation Codes

Operation codes define the manufacturing step associated with the inventory.

Usage

When adding or moving inventory, you may be required to specify an Operation Code. This helps track the progress of WIP through the manufacturing process.

Validation

Like parts, operation codes are validated against the Infor Visual database.

Topics.Title: Location Management
Topics.Content:
Location Management

Locations define where inventory is physically stored.

Location Types

  • Stock: Standard warehouse locations.
  • WIP: Work-in-progress locations on the shop floor.
  • Shipping: Staging areas for outbound shipments.

Adding Locations

New locations must be added in Infor Visual first. Once added, they will be available in the WIP Application.

Topics.Title: Item Types
Topics.Content:
Item Types

Item types categorize inventory for reporting and filtering purposes.

Common Types

  • Raw Material: Unprocessed material.
  • WIP: Partially finished goods.
  • Finished Goods: Completed products ready for shipment.

Item types are typically assigned automatically based on the part number and operation code.
